questions.question: Confirm the Equipment with the below provided Image.
upload the image of the equipment, contact the technical team for recorrections and scan the bar code again
confirm is there any physical Damage of the Equipment.
prepare Damage / Incident and Missing report.
connect the equipment to the mains and confirm whether the equipment is getting ON
check and confirm whether the wall outlet is provided with AC voltage of 230.

videos.src: assets/videos/BPL 6108 T/VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING THE WALL OUTLET.mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING THE WALL OUTLET

questions.question: shift the Equipment to another place where the AC voltage of 230 is provided
check the power cord continuity as shown in the video and confirm whether the power cord is defective.

videos.src: assets/videos/BPL 6108 T/VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING THE POWER CORD CABLE.mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING THE POWER CORD CABLE

questions.question: then replace the power cord with the new one
check and confirm whether the power input connector pin for any loose connections, carbon formation, pins Break and Jack pins.
clean or replace the pin accordingly
open the equipment as shown in video, check and confirm whether the input of 12 VDC is available at the PCB.
contact the technical team for repairing the board
check and confirm whether the ON key on the Keypad / Switch board is not responding after pressing. (sentence changed)
replace the Keypad / Switch Board with a new one
check and confirm whether the Paper is rolling during the ECG is taken.

open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm the motor assembly, gear box assembly motor for loose connections, gears teeth breaks or for any springs detached and for any dust formation.
fix them accordingly
replace the motor assembly with a new one
check and confirm whether the print out of ECG is dull.
check and confirm whether the input voltage to the battery (18VDC) is received.
charging circuit on the main PCB is defective, replace it
replace the battery with the new one and confirm whether the problem still persist.
clean the Thermal head and confirm whether the issue still occurs.
replace the Thermal Head with a new one
check and confirm there is print on the paper during the ECG is taken
check and confirm whether the input voltage to the battery (18VDC) is received.
charging circuit on the main PCB is defective, replace it
replace the battery with the new one and confirm whether the problem still persist
check the Thermal head for any loose connections and clean the thermal head for any dust formation.
fix them accordingly
replace the Thermal head assembly with a new one
check and confirm whether there is lot of AC and muscle interference in the ECG print out.
check the AC line for earthing and connect it properly

videos.src: assets/videos/BPL 6108 T/VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING AC LINE FOR EARTHING..mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING AC LINE FOR EARTHING.

questions.question: check and confirm whether there is a straight line in the ECG print
image: IMAGES REQUIRED OF ECG PRINT WITH STRAIGHT LINE

questions.question: replace the main board

videos.src: assets/videos/BPL 6108 T/VIDEO REQUIRED FOR REPLACING THE MAIN BOARD.mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO REQUIRED FOR REPLACING THE MAIN BOARD

questions.question: If the problem is not yet solved, contact the Technical Team for any other assistance through video call.
Thanks
